books.author: Charles Duhigg
books.title: The Power of Habit
books.description: The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business is a book by Charles Duhigg. It explores the science behind habit creation and reformation.

books.author: Dale Carnegie
books.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
books.description: How to Win Friends and Influence People is one of the first best-selling self-help books ever published.

books.author: Daniel Kahneman
books.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
books.description: Thinking, Fast and Slow is a best-selling book published in 2011 by Nobel Memorial Prize in Economics laureate Daniel Kahneman.

books.author: Stephen Covey
books.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
books.description: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People, first published in 1989, is a business and self-help book written by Stephen R. Covey.

books.author: Rhonda Byrne
books.title: The Secret
books.description: The Secret is a best-selling 2006 self-help book written by Rhonda Byrne, based on the earlier film of the same name.

books.author: Napoleon Hill
books.title: Think and Grow Rich
books.description: Think and Grow Rich was written in 1937 by Napoleon Hill, promoted as a personal development and self-improvement book.

books.author: Eckhart Tolle
books.title: The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment
books.description: The book is intended to be a guide for day-to-day living and stresses the importance of living in the present moment and avoiding thoughts of the past or future.

books.author: M. Scott Peck
books.title: The ROAD LESS TRAVELED
books.description: Dr. M. Scott Peck, a practicing psychiatrist, suggests ways in which confronting and resolving our problems can enable us to reach a higher level of self-understanding.

books.author: Timothy Ferris
books.title: The 4-Hour Workweek
books.description: The 4-Hour Workweek: Escape 9-5, Live Anywhere, and Join the New Rich is a self-help book by Timothy Ferriss, an American writer, educational activist, and entrepreneur.

books.author: Maxwell Maltz
books.title: Psycho-Cybernetics
books.description: Psycho-Cybernetics is a self-help book written by Maxwell Maltz in 1960. Motivational and self-help experts in personal development, including Zig Ziglar, Tony Robbins, Brian Tracy have based their techniques on Maxwell Maltz.

books.author: Jen Sincero
books.title: You Are a Badass
books.description: YOU ARE A BADASS IS THE SELF-HELP BOOK FOR PEOPLE WHO DESPERATELY WANT TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES BUT DON'T WANT TO GET BUSTED DOING IT.

books.author: Gretchen Rubin
books.title: The Happiness Project
books.description: The Happiness Project was written by Gretchen Rubin, one of the world's most influential and inspirational writers of self-help books today.

books.author: Spencer Johnson
books.title: Who Moved My Cheese?
books.description: Who Moved My Cheese? An Amazing Way to Deal with Change in Your Work and in Your Life, published on September 8, 1998, is a motivational business fable.

books.author: David Schwartz
books.title: The Magic of Thinking Big
books.description: The Magic of Thinking Big, first published in 1959, is a self-help book by David Schwartz. The book which has sold over 4 million copies, instructs people to set their goals high and think positively to achieve them.

books.author: Robert Greene
books.title: The 48 Laws of Power
books.description: The 48 Laws of Power is the first book by American author Robert Greene. The book is a bestseller, selling over 1.2 million copies in the United States, and is popular with prison inmates and celebrities.

books.author: Louisa L. Hay
books.title: You Can Heal Your Life
books.description: You Can Heal Your Life is 1984 self-help and new thought book by Louisa L. Hay. It was the second book by the author, after Heal your Body which she wrote at age 60.

books.author: Michael A. Singer
books.title: The Untethered Soul: The Journey Beyond Yourself
books.description: This beautiful hardcover gift edition with satin ribbon bookmark features a new preface by author and spiritual teacher Michael A. Singer.

books.author: Dale Carnegie
books.title: How to Stop Worrying and Start Living
books.description: How to Stop Worrying and Start Living is a self-help book by Dale Carnegie. It was first printed in Great Britain in 1948 by Richard Clay, Ltd., Bungay Suffolk.

books.author: Gary W. Keller and Jay Papasan
books.title: The ONE Thing
books.description: The ONE Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results is a non-fiction, self-help book written by authors and real estate entrepreneurs, Gary W. Keller and Jay Papasan.

books.author: Eckhart Tolle
books.title: A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life’s Purpose
books.description: A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life’s Purpose is a self-help book by Eckhart Tolle. First published in 2005, it sold 5 million copies in North America by 2009.
